bibl.title: Letter from Caroline Latimer to Howard A. Kelly, November 19, 1908

div1.p: Latimer writes that it may be necessary to appeal directly to Andrew Carnegie himself on behalf of the Kissingers.

div1.head: Letter from Caroline Latimer to Howard A. Kelly, November 19, 1908
div1.p:
I return Dr.
Welch's note about Kis-
singer and also the
one to him. I think
the thing to be done
is to write at once to
Mr. (or Dr.?) Ernst and
give him the information
he wants. I think
moli He offers to under-
take the details and
Ac
Ki
I think it would be best
to let him do so. Dr
Welch, I see, advises
applying to Mr. Carnegie
personally if the other
appeal fails. I enclose
some notes for the letter
that Miss Murphy could
use, thinking it may
save you trouble.

I see from Mr. Ernst's
letter that he must
have heard of the matter
through the letters I
I wrote to the editor of the Boston
Med. & Surg. Jounal. What a
good thing I put that letter
in the Transcript! It was that
which made the editor write
to me.

I hope you will let me
know when you hear from
Mr. Ernst. I need not tell
you I shall be delighted
to do anything I can for the
Kissingers. I have written
Mrs Kissinger, adivising her
to drop her outside work.
